Text:
@DasheriM 
I saw your contributions, two cheesy repacked games, wow, don't waste your time or ours.

These rips are made with burning to DVD in mind which is why they are larger file size and @320 kbps audio, not to be viewed on a bugged machine with a cheesy player and outdated codecs.  The avi container is good compression w/o loss and Regional friendly.

i can back the other guy up:

for a 3GB file, the video quality is dreadful.

just by comparison, i get roughly the same quality from a 700-900mb file. this film has probably been compressed at some point.

the film is great, but 3GB for such a lossy video file is not great.

oh and just for context - i'm running a high end machine, with latest 64bit operating system, latest video codecs, massive GFX card with up to date drivers for everything. on a 30 inch HD screen.

trust me, if the quality is suspect, i can tell. it's not anything to do with my computer or anything else.
